importance: This paper is important because it presents a novel approach to modeling individual human behavior at scale using **multi-task learning and parameter-efficient fine-tuning**. This is a significant advancement over existing methods which are either not scalable or not generative. The findings open up new avenues for research in behavioral stylometry and AI-human interaction, and could have a broad impact on many applications including gaming, personalized education and more.
summary: Generative model reveals individual player styles in chess and Rocket League, enabling scalable behavioral stylometry and style manipulation.
takeaways: The proposed multi-task learning approach with parameter-efficient fine-tuning (PEFT) allows for the creation of generative models of individual behavior at an unprecedented scale.
The method successfully performs behavioral stylometry in chess (47,864 players) and Rocket League (2,000 players) with high accuracy.
Style vectors, learned as a part of this model, provides a method to synthesize and steer new player styles.
tldr:
Most existing works on behavioral modeling focus on aggregate data. This approach is not suitable for personalized AI systems. This paper addresses this limitation by focusing on **modeling individual human behavior at scale**.  Existing methods to perform such behavioral stylometry are either not scalable or not generative. They can not generate actions in the style of each person. 
This research proposes a novel approach to behavioral stylometry, casting it as a **multi-task learning problem**. It leverages **parameter-efficient fine-tuning (PEFT)** methods to learn explicit style vectors for each individual. These style vectors are generative; they selectively activate shared parameters to produce actions in each person's style.  It introduces a novel technique for style steering which helps to identify players with a specific desired property and steers a new player towards that property. This approach is applied to chess and Rocket League games, demonstrating its effectiveness in diverse game domains.
